review: My biggest gripes with the AppleTV is the lack of video apps and its inability to autoplay.  If you buy a series on iTunes, you need to click to start each episode.  If you are watching Hulu Plus, same thing.  The Roku will at least offer Autoplay in many apps, including Hulu Plus, where you can marathon a series without being interrupted to needing to find the remote after each episode and then click around to get to the next episode.My other gripe is Airplay with a mid-2012 Macbook Pro (upgraded with 16B ram and 512GB SSD) along with 80 MBps (yes, eighty MBps) wired internet.  There is a lag of about 1-2 seconds when you use the Airplay feature to play what you have on the laptop on the TV.  Voices do not line up with the audio, which is very annoying.I just find the AppleTV very limited at best.  Yes, I can watch video from my iPhone 4S, iPad 3, or 2012 MBP on my TV, but that's really about the extent of this device.I own a Roku 2 HD, PS3, Wii and Wii U, iPhone 4S, iPad 3, mid-2012 MBP.  I use the PS3 the most for streaming, followed by the Roku 2 HD.  I lent my AppleTV to a family member, who I think after one or two days gave up on it, and it is siting in their drawer.If Apple opened the AppleTV up to app makers for more streaming video choices, as well as the ability to Autoplay, then I would highly recommend it.  Problem is the are far too few choices for streaming, and there is no autoplay feature.  It's just too limited when you compare this device to competitors.
author: Michael DEredita "Mike"
